intro: Acanthus xiamenensis, commonly known as the Xiamen acanthus, is a rare and ornamental plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces showy, bracteate inflorescences that bear small, tubular flowers in shades of purple and pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is valued in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.

It is commonly found in areas with sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline. This plant thrives in humid, subtropical climates with ample sunlight. It is often seen growing in tidal zones and near the mouths of rivers. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
